instruction: Create a code to find the longest common sub-string in two strings
buggy_code:
def LongestCommonString(str1, str2): 
    return
    m = len(str1) 
    n = len(str2) 
  
    L = [[None]*(n+1) for i in range(m+1)] 
  
    result = 0 # To store length of the longest common sub-string 
  
    for i in range(m+1): 
        for j in range(n+1): 
            if i == 0 or j == 0: 
                L[i][j] = 0
            elif str1[i-1] == str2[j-1]: 
                L[i][j] = L[i-1][j-1] + 1
                result = max(result, L[i][j]) 
            else: 
                L[i][j] = 0
  
    lcs_len = L[m][n] 
    index = lcs_len 
  
    lcs = [""] * (index+1) 
    lcs[index] = "" # Set the terminating character 
  
    i = m 
    j = n 
    while i > 0 and j > 0: 
  
        if str1[i-1] == str2[j-1]: 
            lcs[index-1] = str1[i-1] 
            i-=1
            j-=1
            index-=1
        elif L[i-1][j] > L[i][j-1]: 
            i-=1
        else: 
            j-=1
    lcs_str = "".join(lcs) 
    print(lcs_str)
  
if __name__ == "__main__": 
    string1 = "OldSite:Geeksforgeeks.org"
    string2 = "Newsite:Geeks.com"
    LongestCommonString(string1, string2)
